hero.title: Inside the Philippines’ booming underground surrogacy industry
hero.description: There is no law that governs surrogacy in the country, but those involved in the secret world of renting out wombs say that demand is increasing, opening the door to exploitation

primary.lead: Sara Duterte Lashes out on Marcos Administration
primary.title: Sara Duterte: Philippines' political feud takes a dramatic turn
primary.description: The powerful Marcos-Duterte alliance has spectacularly unravelled in the Philippines.

secondary.title: Explainer: How VP Sara's 'kill' remark vs Marcoses may violate Anti-Terror Law
secondary.description: One of the possible charges indicated in the subpoena is under the controversial Anti-Terrorism Law, which was signed into law by Sara Duterte’s father, former President Rodrigo Duterte.

secondary.title: NBI to issue subpoena vs Duterte
secondary.description: The Department of Justice (DOJ) will issue a subpoena against Vice President Sara Duterte in relation to her assassination remark against President Ferdinand “Bongbong“ Marcos

secondary.title: Marcos: Impeachment vs. VP a waste of time - Manila Standard
secondary.description: President Ferdinand “Bongbong” Marcos Jr. left the door open to a possible reconciliation with Duterte

carousel.title: Sagibu: Landless farmers get taste of owning land
carousel.description: Manila, Philippines—There are 2.4 million rice farmers in the Philippines, but only over 50 percent have their own land, the Philippine Rice Research Institute (PhilRice) said.

carousel.title: How sachets are fueling a plastic waste crisis in the Philippines
carousel.description: Story: Stretching across an area as vast as five soccer fields, this massive landfill highlights the scale of the plastic waste crisis gripping Southeast Asia.

carousel.title: China issues new missile warning to US and Philippines
carousel.description: China urged Washington and Manila to withdraw the Mid-Range Capability missile system from the Philippines immediately.

carousel.title: Trump Will Be a Philippine Military Ally But a Climate Enemy
carousel.description: Manila is worried about Chinese maritime aggression and rising seas.
